STIPULATION of dismissal with proposed order that pursuant to Rule 41(a)(1)(ii) of the Fed.R.Civ.P. and the settlement agreement entered into by the parties dismiss this action with prejudice. The Court shall retain jurisdiction over the Settlement Agreement for a period of one year to enforce all provisions and to resolve any disputes between the parties. (sm) (Entered: 07/23/1999)

SCHEDULING ORDER setting Discovery cutoff 12/4/98 ; Deadline for filing dispositive motions 12/30/98 ; Pretrial conference for 2:00 1/28/99 ; Proposed Pretrial Order due on 1/25/99 ( signed by Judge Joseph J. Farnan Jr. ) copies to: counsel (sm) (Entered: 07/09/1998)

case_data.name: EEOC v. L'OSTERIA RESTAURANT
case_data.plaintiff_description: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, on behalf of one or more workers.
case_data.summary: EEOC's Wilmington, DE office filed this lawsuit against the defendant L'Osteria Restaurant at the United States District Court for the District of Delaware (Wilmington) on 11/18/1997. On 07/21/1999, the parties filed a joint motion to dismiss the case after reaching a settlement agreement. District Judge Joseph J. Farnan granted the motion on 07/26/1999 and closed the case. With access only to the docket, there is no information about the complaint, the complainant, or what kind of relief was obtained.
